Welcome to Oncoscape.

A data visualization platform that empowers researchers to discover novel patterns and relationships between clinical and molecular data. Through a suite of interoperable tools, Oncoscape offers a unique and intuitive approach to hypothesis refinement.

Iterative Analysis

Seamlessly transfer knowledge among analytical tools. Discover new patterns and relationships by connecting diverse questions and answers.

Learn More ›

Cohort Discovery

Easily define patient sets of interest. Build, refine, and scale cohorts based on clinical and/or molecular factors.

Learn More ›

Interactive Visualizations

Access data and methods through a suite of visual tools. Combine the power of analysis and discovery through the simple click of a mouse.

Learn More ›

Interdisciplinary Science

Researchers

Interested in tumor progression and molecular functions for an individual patient or patients within a scalable population.

Bioinformaticians

Interested in developing, comparing, or validating models of response for given diseases.

Clinicians

Interested in determining the best clinical treatment for a patient given their demographic and tumor molecular profile.

Available Tools

  • PCA

    Principle Component Analysis: two dimensional view of sample similarity.

  • Markers + Patients

    Link copy number variation and mutation data to patients.

  • Timelines

    Comparative view of patient histories.

  • Survival

    Kaplan Meier curves of overall survival for patient cohorts.

  • Spreadsheet

    Interactive table of clinical fields.

Datasets

Oncoscape hosts level 3 public TCGA datasets representing gene and patient data downloaded from UCSC Xena. To review this data in depth visit our data API. User planning to publish on the provided data must adhere to all publishing guideline set by the NIH. Datasets in Oncoscape are classified by disease type according to TCGA studies.

  • Brain

    Unique Samples: 1126

    Unique Patient: 1105

  • Lung

    Unique Samples: 1194

    Unique Patient: 1079

  • Breast

    Unique Samples: 1230

    Unique Patient: 1100

  • Head + Neck

    Unique Samples: 575

    Unique Patient: 529

  • Prostate

    Unique Samples: 552

    Unique Patient: 449

Developers

Interested in contributing new methods or visualizations? A version of Oncoscape exist for that! Please visit our development site to view upcoming features or discover areas to contribute. Oncoscape is an open source project hosted on GitHub that utlizes many other open source project such as Docker, MongoDB and Kong API.

Acknowledgements

Oncoscape is developed at the Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center under the auspices of the Seattle Translational Tumor Research initiative.

x

Use Cases

Selecting, saving and transferring cohorts

Select EGFR cohorts with/without Amplification

    Getting Started

    1. Login Oncoscape
    2. To get started with Cancer Explorer, click the EXPLORE button
    3. Choose disease dataset Brain (Brain is a combination of Glioblastoma + Lower Grade Glioma)
    4. Select the analysis tool Markers + Patients (M+P)

    Selecting & Saving Cohorts

    1. In M+P, if needed, adjust the layout so all parts are visible and centered using the mouse scroll or track pad
    2. In the Edge Visibility box on the Control Bar (right upper side), toggle Amplification to “OFF”
    3. Using the Search box on the Control Bar (right middle side) type EGFR and click Go
    4. Above the Search box a count of selected will appear and the gene will be highlighted orange with a black boarder
    5. To see the associated patient nodes, click Show Edges of Selected from the Commands list (right middle side, blue text) on the Control Bar
    6. The edges (Mutation, Gain, Loss, Deletion) connecting the EGFR selection and the patient nodes will be visualized
    7. To grab the patient nodes to create a cohort, click Select Connected Nodes from the Commands list (right middle side, blue text). Patient nodes will now be outlined in black. NOTE: To create cohorts with more than one mutation see M+P Use Cases
    8. To view a snapshot of clinical information from the selected cohort use the Clinical Histogram dropdown (upper left side) on the cohort panel
    9. To save the EGFR cohort, name the cohort in the Selected Cohort box (upper left side) on the cohort panel and click the "+" button. Example Name: EGFR Edges minus Amplification. The new cohort will now be color-coded and appear under Cohorts
    10. Click anywhere on the M+P window white space to deselect the last cohort
    11. Click Hide All Edges from the Commands list (right middle side, blue text)
    12. In the Edge Visibility box (right upper side), toggle Amplification to “ON” and turn all other sections to “OFF”
    13. Using the Search box on the Control Bar (right middle side) type EGFR and click Go
    14. To see the associated patient nodes, click Show Edges of Selected from the Commands list (right middle side, blue text)
    15. To grab the patient nodes to create a cohort, click Select Connected Nodes from the Commands list (right middle side, blue text). Patient nodes will now be outlined in black
    16. To save the EGFR cohort, name the cohort in the Selected Cohort box(upper left side) on the cohort panel and click the "+" button. Example Name: EGFR Edges Amplification ONLY. The new cohort will now be color-coded and appear under Cohorts
    17. Users are able to toggle between cohorts by selecting from either the Selected Cohorts dropdown or by clicking on the desired cohort in the Cohorts section

    Transferring Cohorts

    1. Saved cohorts can be visualized in other analysis tools
    2. In the header click Tools, from the dropdown select Survival
    3. Selections in Survival can be toggled ON or OFF in the same manor as the Edge Visibility box in M+P
    4. In survival view the P-values for the cohort with EGFR Amplification vs the cohort without EGFR Amplification

Building cohorts in Spreadsheet and analyzing in other tools

Build Triple Negative and Luminal A Cohorts

    Getting Started

    1. Login Oncoscape
    2. To get started with Cancer Explorer, click the EXPLORE button
    3. Choose disease dataset Breast
    4. Select an analysis tool.

    Selecting & Saving Cohorts

    1. In spreadsheet, by default all the columns will be selected and the Clinical Collection will be the patient table. To select the appropriate columns for specific cohorts, click on the Select Columns button (right, top of the spreadsheet)
    2. The pop-up will list all the available columns, click the Deselect All button, then select patient ID, breast carcinoma estrogen receptor status, breast carcinoma progesterone receptor status and lab proc her2 immunohistochemistry receptor status
    3. Click the “x” to close
    4. On the patient ID column, click the down arrow and pin the column to the left
    5. On the breast carcinoma estrogen receptor status column, click the down arrow and select group. All the options will now be grouped
    6. Within the estrogen receptor status column, expand “(+)” the Negative row. All selections shown will be ER Negative and a mix of PR +/- and HER2 +/-
    7. On the breast carcinoma progesterone receptor status column, click the down arrow and click group
    8. Follow the same steps as the estrogen receptor status and expand the Negative row. All selections shown will be ER Negative and PR Negative with a mix of HER2 +/-
    9. Repeat this step for the lab proc her2 immunohistochemistry receptor status column
    10. The expanded rows will now be a subset of the breast datasets representing ER-, PR- and HER2- (Triple Negative)
    11. Within the triple negative subset, click on the first √ line and while holding the Shift key and select the last √ line. This will select all the triple negative patients
    12. To save the cohort, name the cohort in the Selected Cohort box and click the "+" button. Example Name: Breast: Triple Negative. The new cohort will now be color-coded and appear under Cohorts
    13. To select the Luminal A cohort, close all the extended rows by clicking the “-“ buttons and ungroup all the columns.
    14. From the cohort panel, select “All Patients + Samples”
    15. The spreadsheet should be back to default to create the next cohort, Luminal A where the above steps will be repeated
    16. On the breast carcinoma estrogen receptor status column, click the down arrow and click group
    17. Expand the Positive row. All selections shown will be ER Positive and a mix of PR +/- & HER2 +/-
    18. Repeat this grouping/expanding step for the lab proc her2 immunohistochemistry receptor status column, only expanding the Negative row
    19. The expanded rows will now be a subset of the breast datasets representing ER+, HER2- and a mix of PR-/+ (Luminal A)
    20. Within the Luminal A subset, click on the first √ line and while holding the Shift key and select the last √ line. This will select all the Luminal A patients
    21. To save the cohort, name the cohort in the Selected Cohort box and click the "+" button. Example Name: Breast: Luminal A. The new cohort will now be color-coded and appear under Cohorts

    Transferring Cohorts

    1. Saved cohorts can be visualized in other analysis tools
    2. In the header click Tools, from the dropdown select PCA
    3. View pattern among patients by toggling between cohorts either by selecting from either the Selected Cohorts dropdown or by clicking on the desired cohort in the Cohorts section
x

Get Started

The power of Oncoscape lies in the ability to create and move cohorts through the various tools.

Creating a saved cohort is easy. On the left side of all tools is the cohort panel. All functions related to cohorts are preformed here. Summaries for the various sections are below. It is important to note that as cohorts are selected and toggled between the clinical histograms, survival curves and summaries will update.


Selected Cohort: Add, edit or delete cohorts. Click the "+ " to save, "x " to delete or click the down arrow to select a cohort for edits.

Clinical Histogram: Snapshot of clinical information, per cohort. The histogram will adjust with each cohort selection.Click the down arrow to view other filters.   e.g.   Age At Diagnosis, Gender, Race, Ethnicity, Vital, Tumor.

Survival Curve: Snapshot of Kaplan Meier survival curves, per cohort. For more in depth analysis push the saved cohorts to the survival tool.

Cohorts: All saved cohorts are listed in this area. Each cohort is clickable and will highlight the selections on the main window, as well as adjust any survival curves or clinical histograms that are associated. The last line will always show your current selection, which will also update in the Selected Cohort box at the top of the cohort panel.

Cohort Summary: Every cohort includes a summary of available information based on patients and samples.


Transfer Cohorts

Transfer cohorts at the click of a button.

Once cohorts have been created it is easy to move them to different tools for additional analysis. In the main header find the Analysis Tools button and select a new tool. The left cohort panel will appear in each tool. Additional help for individual tools can be found in the Available Tools section.

x

Data

All genesets used in Oncoscape can be viewed at Geneset Details.

Oncoscape's data is based on a gene/patient relationship as defined: “non-silent somatic mutation (nonsense, missense, frame-shift indels, splice site mutations, stop codon readthroughs, change of start codon, inframe indels) was identified in the protein coding region of a gene, or any mutation identified in a non-coding gene”. Credit to Xena UCSC.

x

Frequently Asked Questions

What tools have export features?

Currently, the export feature is only available on the Spreadsheet tool. Users can push saved cohorts to the spreadsheet tool by clicking the the Analysis Tool button at the top of the screen. Once there click the Export button. An Excel file will get generated.

How is data saved for return visits?

All data for selections and cohorts will be automatically saved for a return visit assuming users are on the same computer to login. User logins that allow stored sessions from any device will be deployed in a future release.

How to contact the Oncoscape team directly?

On the homepage header, click the contact link, fill out the form and someone from the Oncoscape team will contact you shortly.
